title: Clemson hands Irish first loss
text:
Clemson hands Irish first loss 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive University of Notre Dame Fighting Irish October 3, 2015 Updated Oct 3, 2015 at 11:49 PM EDT 
CLEMSON, SC (21 Alive) - Clemson's defense repulsed a Notre Dame potential game tying two point conversion attempt in the final seconds Saturday night as the Irish fell for the first time this season 24-22. 
Clemson led 21-3 entering the fourth quarter, but DeShone Kizer led Notre Dame back with a touchdown pass and a touchdown run before hitting Torii Hunter, Jr. from a yard out in the final seconds to make it 24-22. 
But the two point try to send the game to overtime came up short.
